sections.heading: of judgment; defect of form insufficient
sections.text: No judgment can be arrested for a defect of form.SourceG.S.1873, c. 58, § 494, p. 832;R.S.1913, § 9135;C.S.1922, § 10160;C.S.1929, § 29-2105;R.S.1943, § 29-2105.AnnotationsA defendant who pleads not guilty without having raised the question of the lack of or

29-2105.Arrest of judgment; defect of form insufficient.

No judgment can be arrested for a defect of form.

SourceG.S.1873, c. 58, § 494, p. 832;R.S.1913, § 9135;C.S.1922, § 10160;C.S.1929, § 29-2105;R.S.1943, § 29-2105.

Annotations

A defendant who pleads not guilty without having raised the question of the lack of or a defective verification waives the defect. State v. Gilman, 181 Neb. 390, 148 N.W.2d 847 (1967).
